subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: quikscript.org + Unicode/PUA fonts

messageBody:
Scott Ellsworth scott@... [Read_Alphabet] scripsit:

> 1. As I understand, mapping Quikscript characters to Unicode is still
> temporary, since Quikscript does not yet have any officially allocated
> section in Unicode. So if and when Quikscript does get some Unicode
> space allocated, any font I create now for PUA/Unicode will become
> obsolete.

Not necessarily. You can configure the CMAP table in the font to map
both PUA and standard codepoints to the same set of glyphs.
For that matter, you could have a triple mapping: low-end code points,
PUA code points, and (when defined) standard code points. In that
way the font would be usable with documents in all these encodings.

--
John Cowan http://www.ccil.org/~cowan cowan@...
Almost all theorems are true, but almost all proofs have bugs.
--Paul Pedersen
